0.title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes Philippines' Mindanao island
0.article_body: The European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) on Tuesday said a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Mindanao island in the Philippines. No injuries or damage have been reported so far. The EMSC said the quake was recorded at a depth of 10 km. The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said aftershocks and damage are expected following the earthquake.

1.title: Captain of large Russian landing ship killed in Ukraine: Reports
1.article_body: The captain of a large Russian landing ship has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Governor of Sevastopol Mikhail Razvozhayev said Captain Alexander Chirva died from wounds he sustained during a battle with Ukrainian defenders. Captain Chirva was the commander of the Russian landing ship Caesar Kunikov which is a part of Russia's Black Sea fleet.

2.title: Maharashtra reports 137 new COVID-19 cases, three deaths
2.article_body: Maharashtra, on Tuesday, logged 137 new COVID-19 cases taking its tally to 78,76,041, the latest health department bulletin showed. There were three casualties reported as well, pushing the overall death tally to 1,47,830, according to the bulletin. Out of three new deaths in Maharashtra, Pune accounted for two deaths while Parbhani saw a single fatality.

3.title: Real estate prices may increase by 10-15% across India: CREDAI
3.article_body: Real estate industry body CREDAI on Tuesday said real estate prices have increased 5-8% due to a rise in construction costs and are expected to rise further by 5-7%, CREDAI National President HV Patodia said. There's been a steady increase in raw material costs in last two years and the Ukraine war further caused a rise in costs, he added.

4.title: Live-in relationships are leading to rise in sexual offences: MP High Court
4.article_body: The "bane of live-in relationship", a "byproduct" of rights conferred under Article 21 of the Constitution, is leading to a rise in sexual offences, Madhya Pradesh High Court said. It made the observation while rejecting anticipatory bail plea of a man accused of raping a woman. The complainant got pregnant and underwent abortions under pressure from her then partner.

5.title: Assam authorities alert districts to be prepared to tackle floods
5.article_body: The government of Assam has started the preparations to deal with the flood situation and alerted all the districts to be ready as well. "We have identified locations based on the last 10 years' flood data [and]...identified 11 circles that are spread over five districts that receive floods almost every year," CEO of Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

6.title: Odisha CM Patnaik sanctions ₹120 cr for Kendu leaf pluckers
6.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik sanctioned ₹120 crore for bonus and other allowances for Kendu leaf pluckers and other seasonal workers. A statement from the Chief Minister's office said, "It will benefit around 8 lakh Kendu leaf pluckers, binders and other seasonal staff." The state government also decided to increase the collection price of Kendu leaf for 2022.

7.title: US President Joe Biden should come to Ukraine: President Zelenskyy
7.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US President Joe Biden "should come" to visit Ukraine. "It's his decision of course and they must consider the safety situation. But I think he's the leader of the United States and that's why he should come here to see," Zelenskyy said. The White House has since stated Biden has "no plans" to visit Ukraine.

8.title: MHA designates LeT commander Sheikh Sajad as terrorist under UAPA
8.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs designated Sheikh Sajad, a commander of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), as a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. The ministry stated in a notification that Sajad has been absconding in a case related to the recovery of arms and ammunition in Jammu and Kashmir. He has also been recruiting the youth of J&K into LeT.

9.title: Sri Lankan PM offers to hold talks with anti-govt protesters
9.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday offered to hold talks with anti-government protesters amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Earlier, the protesters had said that they would only leave if PM Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa step down. Notably, the opposition has threatened to bring a no-confidence motion against the government over its handling of the crisis.

10.title: Electric chopsticks that can make food taste saltier developed in Japan
10.article_body: Researchers in Japan claim that they have developed computerised chopsticks that can make food taste saltier, in a "world first". Co-developed by Meiji University professor Homei Miyashita and beverage maker Kirin Holdings, the device uses electrical stimulation and is attached to a mini wristband computer. The chopsticks can potentially help people reduce their salt intake, the researchers said.

11.title: He was the cement that build RCB innings: Jaffer on Du Plessis' 96 vs LSG
11.article_body: After RCB captain Faf du Plessis' 64-ball 96 helped his side post 181/6 in 20 overs against LSG in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "From 21*(20) to 50*(40) to 96(64). Faf was the cement that build RCB innings." He added, "Masterclass in how to rebuild after an early collapse." RCB were reduced to 7/2 after the first over.

12.title: Cong isn't dead, will play role of constructive opp'n in Punjab: Sidhu
12.article_body: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu, while speaking about the party's loss in the state Assembly elections this year, said that the "Congress party has lost but isn't dead". He added that Congress will be playing the role of a constructive opposition in Punjab and that they will "work to provide the solution to the problems of people".

13.title: 12 states face power crisis due to coal shortage: Maha Minister
13.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said that 12 states are facing electricity issues due to the shortage of coal and that his department was working to mitigate the shortage. "Shortage is also due to lack of rakes (trains). We require 37 rakes per day, while we get only 26. Each rake can transport 4,000 metric tonnes of coal," Raut said.

14.title: Hubballi rioters will be tried as per existing law: Karnataka CM
14.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has said that those involved in the Hubballi riots will be tried as per the existing laws in the state. "When riots took place in Uttar Pradesh, certain action was taken according to the situation prevailing over there. We are reviewing the situation in Karnataka. We will go by our law," Bommai said.

15.title: Ayodhya's security increased along with Ram Temple: Report
15.article_body: Ahead of the final stage of completion of the plinth at the Ram Temple, the security in Ayodhya has been reportedly increased. Entire city has been reportedly kept under the surveillance of CCTV cameras and soldiers have been deployed on watchtowers to monitor people. According to the report, the city will also get a new control room for security.

16.title: 22-yr-old techie's laptop catches fire in Andhra, she suffers 80% burns
16.article_body: A 22-year-old software engineer from Andhra Pradesh suffered around 80% burns after the laptop she was working on triggered a fire, police said. The incident took place on Monday when sparks from Sumalatha's laptop, which was being charged, caused a fire that spread rapidly in her room. As per a preliminary probe, the fire originated from the laptop's charger adapter.

17.title: PM Modi shares pic after meeting Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh; Poland reacts
17.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh in Gujarat's Jamnagar and wrote, "The goodwill of Jam Saheb's family is spread all over the world, especially in Europe." Responding to his tweet, Poland's envoy Adam Burakowski tweeted, "PM of India...visited Jam Saheb, son of Jam Saheb Digvijay Sinhji who during II World War hosted c.a. 800 Polish children in Balachadi."

18.title: ₹2.58 lakh crore wiped off HDFC & HDFC Bank's market value in 9-day sell-off
18.article_body: As much as ₹2.58 lakh crore has been wiped out of the combined market value of HDFC Ltd and HDFC Bank in a nine-day sell-off. The development comes after the two companies announced their merger earlier this month. HDFC Ltd, which was among India's top 10 most valuable companies prior to the announcement, is no longer on the list.

19.title: Anguished by the tragic accident in Jhunjhunu: PM Narendra Modi
19.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish and offered condolences over the road accident in Jhunjhunu, Rajasthan, where 11 members of a family were killed and several others injured after a jeep rammed into a tractor trolley. PM Modi tweeted, "₹2 lakh each from PMNRF would be given to the next of family of the deceased. The injured would be given ₹50,000."

20.title: No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody in India: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
20.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her US visit on Monday said, "No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody (in India)." She said, "The one big step the government decided was we shall not tax people to get out of the pandemic." Calling the building of infrastructure "best multiplier for economic recovery", she added, "Capital expenditure was our route to recovery."

21.title: UK PM apologises for attending surprise b'day party amid lockdown after being fined
21.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson has offered an apology for attending illegal party during lockdown, but said he didn't knowingly break rules or mislead Parliament. Johnson told lawmakers that "it did not occur to me" that the gathering was a party. Last week, Johnson was fined £50 for attending his own surprise birthday party at his official residence in June 2020.

22.title: UN chief calls for 4-day pause to fighting in Ukraine
22.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres has called for a four-day "humanitarian pause to the war in Ukraine" ahead of Orthodox Easter on Sunday. "The onslaught and terrible toll on civilians we've seen so far could pale in comparison to the horror that lies ahead. This cannot be allowed to happen," he said. The war has sparked a humanitarian crisis in Ukraine.

23.title: 5 grenades, 10 pistols among the arms recovered from J&K's Kupwara
23.article_body: A huge cache of arms and ammunition was reportedly recovered from Kupwara district during a search operation conducted by the police along with the Indian Army. Ten pistols, 17 pistol magazines, 54 pistol rounds and five grenades were seized, the police said. On Sunday, the J&K police along with the Army arrested a suspected terrorist and seized ammunition from him.

24.title: My parents love that I am wearing a uniform in 'Runway 34': Rakul
24.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that her parents "love" that she is wearing a uniform in her upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "I have grown up with people in uniform around me," she stated. Rakul added her father gives her critical reviews of her films. "For me, they (her parents) are the public; I get..best reviews from them," Rakul said.

25.title: 23-year-old Mumbai student arrested for selling child pornography
25.article_body: A 23-year-old student from Mumbai was arrested for collecting child pornographic materials, which he sold via the messaging application Telegram, the police said. The Maharashtra cyber-police department had registered an FIR on April 5, after a complaint from an activist who reported it to the police. The accused has been booked under the Information Technology Act, they added.

26.title: Virat Kohli goes 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred
26.article_body: India and RCB batter Virat Kohli has now gone 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred. Kohli, who got out for a golden duck against LSG today, has played 17 Tests, 21 ODIs, 25 T20Is and 37 IPL matches since scoring his previous hundred in November 2019. Kohli's previous hundred came in a Test against Bangladesh.

27.title: Actor Bob Odenkirk honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star
27.article_body: Actor Bob Odenkirk has been honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Monday. Jonathan Banks, Patrick Fabian, Tony Dalton, Giancarlo Esposito, Patrick Fabian, and Michael Mando attended the ceremony. The actor is known for his work in 'Breaking Bad', 'Better Call Saul'. Bob's star was placed next to Bryan Cranston, who was Bob's co-star in 'Breaking Bad'.

28.title: Ukraine denies attacking Russian border village amid ongoing war
28.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday denied accusations by a Russian provincial governor that it had attacked a border village amid countries' ongoing conflict. Vyacheslav Gladkov, Governor of Russian province of Belgorod had accused Ukrainian forces of wounding three people and damaging as many as 30 houses in alleged attack. "Ukraine is conducting a defence operation on its territory," Ukrainian military said.

29.title: Greece impounds oil tanker as part of EU sanctions against Russia
29.article_body: Greece on Tuesday said that it has impounded a Russian oil tanker off the island of Evia. The move is part of efforts by Greece to enforce European Union (EU) sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Earlier this month, the EU had banned Russian-flagged vessels from its ports with some exemptions.

30.title: RCB can make it to the top-four in IPL 2022: Jaffer
30.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said RCB have the team to make it to the top four in IPL 2022. "Form of Dinesh Karthik has been excellent, Glenn Maxwell has come back to form...Shahbaz Ahamad has been playing sensible cricket," he added. Jaffer further said that RCB's bowling looks settled with the presence of Josh Hazlewood and Harshal Patel.

31.title: BSF recovers 2.1 kg of suspected heroin near border in Punjab
31.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) in Punjab's Amritsar sector on Tuesday recovered four packets containing 2.1 kg of suspected heroin along with a pistol, a magazine and 37 Rds. Sharing a picture of the items on Twitter, Punjab Frontier BSF wrote that the recovery was made by the troops while "monitoring harvesting activities of farmers ahead of border fence".

32.title: Oil drops below the $110 mark after IMF cuts global growth forecast
32.article_body: Oil price dipped below the $110 mark on Tuesday after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reduced its global growth forecast and warned of higher inflation. Brent crude fell $3.94 to $109.22/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $3.8 to $104.41/barrel. IMF had said growth in emerging markets and developed economies could reduce by 1.3% and 0.9% over three years.

33.title: LSG skipper KL Rahul has improved his leadership qualities: Jaffer
33.article_body: Talking about KL Rahul, who previously led PBKS in IPL, Wasim Jaffer said the LSG captain's leadership is getting better with time. "I had been involved with Punjab team in the last two years and think he's a phenomenal player and has scored runs against all teams," he added. LSG are currently third on points table in IPL 2022.

34.title: He touched our hearts: PM Modi after WHO chief greets public in Gujarati
34.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has thanked WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus for speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English during an inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Jamnagar. PM Modi said, "[Tedros] made us feel 'Triveni'...and touched our hearts by speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English." Tedros had greeted public asking, "Kem cho? Majama? (How're you? Fine?)"

35.title: 13,964 posts removed due to increasing communal tension: Mumbai Police
35.article_body: Around 13,964 social media posts have been deleted in the last four months due to an increase in communal tension and violence in the country, the Mumbai Police said. The special branch of Mumbai Police deleted 5,754 posts in January, 4,252 posts in February and 3,958 social media posts in March.

36.title: Russia expels 15 Dutch envoys in retaliatory move amid Ukraine war
36.article_body: Russia on Tuesday expelled 15 Dutch diplomats from the country, its Foreign Ministry said. Among those expelled, 14 persons were employees at the Dutch embassy in Moscow and one was a staffer at the Dutch Consulate General in St. Petersburg. The move comes in response to the expulsion of 17 Russian envoys in the Netherlands last month amid Ukraine invasion.

37.title: Centre writes to 4 states & Delhi amid rise in COVID-19 cases, positivity rate
37.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Maharashtra and Mizoram on the increasing coronavirus positivity rate and cases in these places. India recorded 1,247 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday. Delhi has been recording over 500 COVID-19 cases for the past three days with a positivity rate of over 4%.

38.title: Kindergartener brings tequila to school, gets classmates drunk in US
38.article_body: A kindergartener aged between three and six allegedly brought a tequila-based drink to school in US' Michigan and shared it with friends, who thought it was juice. Several students reported feeling "dizzy" and "woozy" after consuming the alcoholic drink. "I had a small conversation with my daughter...and she told me the girl knew it was liquor," a parent said.

39.title: There's no ideal body type in entertainment industry: Palak Tiwari
39.article_body: Palak Tiwari said there's no ideal body type in the entertainment industry. "We live in India, an ideal body type is a size medium but people fat shame...size medium. When you are too skinny, they have an issue," she stated. "It's..same toxic circle of people never being happy...don't think it makes any sense paying heed to that," Palak added.

40.title: Need more matches to achieve desired level of tennis: Djokovic
40.article_body: Ahead of Serbia Open second round, Novak Djokovic said he needs more matches to achieve desired level of tennis after exiting early in two tournaments he has played in 2022 season thus far. The world number one added that French Open is his "biggest goal" on clay and he hopes to play more matches in Belgrade than in Monte Carlo.

41.title: LV Vaidyanathan, who joined P&G as an intern, appointed India CEO
41.article_body: Consumer goods company Procter & Gamble (P&G) on Tuesday announced that it has appointed LV Vaidyanathan as the CEO for its operations in India. Vaidyanathan is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad and had joined P&G as an intern in 1995. The 49-year-old is currently leading the P&G business in Indonesia. Vaidyanathan succeeds Madhusudan Gopalan, who'll move to a global role.

42.title: 2 men sentenced to 14 yrs in jail for trafficking minors in Jaipur
42.article_body: A special court in Jaipur on Tuesday sentenced two men to 14 years in jail for trafficking minors and forcing them into child labour. The accused had trafficked at least 33 children from Bihar, who were rescued during a police raid in the city in 2018. A fine of ₹5.64 lakh has also been imposed on each of the accused.

43.title: 'Beta apne ghar par dhyan do': Suniel to troll over his remark after KL Rahul's hundred
43.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty responded to a troll's remark after LSG captain KL Rahul smashed a hundred in his 100th IPL match against MI on Saturday. Suniel had shared an appreciation post, on which the troll commented how in the absence of Suniel and his family, KL Rahul was able to score a century. "Focus on your own home," Suniel replied.

44.title: European Commission Prez to arrive on 2-day visit to India from Apr 24
44.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will arrive on a two-day visit to India from April 24, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. She is scheduled to meet President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi during her first official visit.  She has been invited as the Chief Guest for this year's Raisina Dialogue, the MEA added.

45.title: Leopard that killed an 8-yr-old boy shot dead in U'khand's Tehri
45.article_body: A leopard, which killed an eight-year-old boy in Uttarakhand's Tehri district, was shot dead after it "returned to its kill site to devour the remaining body on Monday", a forest officer said. The boy was attacked while walking to a village to attend a wedding ceremony. Officials believe the leopard attacked humans as its damaged nails prevented it from hunting.

46.title: Heatwave pushes Delhi's power demand to 5,735 MW, highest ever in April
46.article_body: The peak power demand in Delhi on Tuesday rose to 5,735 MW, which is the highest ever in the month of April, after unabated heatwave in the city, discom officials said. Delhi's peak power demand had touched 4,469 MW on April 1. The national capital's previous high power demand was recorded at 5,664 MW on April 30, 2019, officials added.

47.title: Which are the world's most affordable and least affordable cities to buy home?
47.article_body: The US city of Pittsburgh is the most affordable city for buying a house, according to the Demographia International Housing Affordability's study on housing prices for 92 major markets (metropolitan areas). It's followed by Oklahoma City and Rochester in the US, Edmonton in Canada and St. Louis in the US. Hong Kong emerged as the least affordable city for housing.

48.title: 76 Ukrainan prisoners of war freed in swap with Russia: Deputy PM
48.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that Russia handed over 60 soldiers, including 10 officers, and 16 civilians to Ukraine in an exchange for prisoners of war. "This was the fifth exchange of prisoners of war," she added. Separately, Russia began its offensive in eastern Ukraine after pulling its forces from the country's north.

49.title: New Zealand imposes new sanctions on Russian financial institutions
49.article_body: New Zealand Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta on Tuesday said the country is imposing new sanctions on Russian financial institutions such as eight of its largest banks over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Mahuta said New Zealand is imposing sanctions on "18 financial entities, including Russia's central bank, sovereign wealth fund and the largest financial institutions in the country".

50.title: India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030: FM
50.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030. Describing the Indian economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic as "distinct" and "pronounced", Sitharaman said India undertook various structural reforms both before and after the pandemic. India converted the pandemic into an opportunity to further push these reforms, she added.

51.title: Japan's health ministry approves Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine
51.article_body: Japan's health ministry on Tuesday approved Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine as the fourth foreign-developed vaccine for use in the country. The ministry's experts panel endorsed the protein-based vaccine a day earlier. The Japanese government has agreed to purchase 150 million doses of Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine which is expected to be available for use by late May.

52.title: Germany probing displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine
52.article_body: Police across several states in Germany on Monday reportedly opened over 140 investigations into public displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. Most investigations are looking into the use of the symbol 'Z' which has been associated with the invasion after being seen on many of the vehicles used by Russian troops in Ukraine.

53.title: Coach Toni Nadal doesn't want me to play like nephew Rafael: Auger-Aliassime
53.article_body: World number nine Felix Auger-Aliassime said his coach Toni Nadal, Rafael Nadal's uncle and former coach, isn't trying to make him play like his nephew. "We've been together for more than a year now working...things are going good...he (Toni) adapted to the player he's working with," he added. Auger-Aliassime will face Carlos Taberner in Barcelona Open second round on Wednesday.

54.title: Ajay Devgn & Tabu-starrer 'Bholaa' to release on March 30, 2023
54.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Ajay Devgn has announced that his upcoming film 'Bholaa' will release on March 30, 2023. The action-drama film is an official Hindi remake of the 2019 Tamil film 'Kaithi'. The film will also feature Tabu and will be directed by Dharmendra Sharma. Ajay Devgn Ffilms, T-Series Films, Reliance Entertainment and Dream Warrior Pictures will produce 'Bholaa'.

55.title: Former Congress councillor shot at in a local market in Punjab
55.article_body: A former municipal council member belonging to the Congress was shot at by unidentified assailants at a local market in Punjab's Ferozepur on Tuesday. According to the police, Congress leader Mulakh Raj was at the local market with his wife when some men arrived there in an SUV and fired at him before escaping.

56.title: Losing 'iconic' Monaco Grand Prix would be a 'shocker': Pierre Gasly
56.article_body: AlphaTauri's Pierre Gasly said losing the "iconic" Monaco Grand Prix would be a "shocker". "I think, and I really hope, we get to experience it as drivers because it's probably the toughest track of the season, the most challenging, and is my favourite one," Gasly said. The Monaco circuit has been a permanent fixture of the F1 calendar since 1955.

57.title: 2 cattle smugglers killed, 4 cops injured in 'militant ambush' in Assam
57.article_body: Two alleged cattle smugglers were killed and four police personnel were injured during a "militant ambush" in Assam's Kokrajhar district on Tuesday, police said. The pair were being taken to Jomduar area for smuggling routes' identification when their vehicle "came under firing from militants", an officer said. Police retaliated and the gunfire exchanges continued for 10-12 minutes, he added.

58.title: I actually wanted to quit tennis: 2019 US Open champion Andreescu
58.article_body: 2019 US Open champion Bianca Andreescu has revealed she "wanted to quit" tennis before taking a break from tennis earlier this year due to mental health concerns. "It was really bad. I'm privileged in a way for having this opportunity...doing all of this," she added. This week's Porsche Tennis Grand Prix is the 21-year-old's first tournament of the 2022 season.

59.title: WHO Centre is starting of traditional medicine era in world: PM Modi
59.article_body: Speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Gujarat's Jamnagar, PM Narendra Modi said the centre has opened the door of age of traditional medicine in the world. PM Modi said, "It's not just an institution's inauguration, it is the beginning of the traditional medicine era in the world for the next 25 years."

60.title: Delhi sees 632 fresh COVID-19 cases, positivity rate drops to 4.42% from 7.72%
60.article_body: Delhi reported 632 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a day after it saw 501 cases. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 4.42% as compared to 7.72% reported on Monday. The city saw zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 1,274.

61.title: Intense solar storm hits Earth, causes radio blackout in parts of Asia & Australia
61.article_body: An intense solar storm hit the Earth over the past weekend and caused radio blackouts in parts of Asia and Australia, US Space Weather Prediction Center said. As per the agency, the solar flare peaked late on Sunday (April 17) at 3.34 GMT (9.04 IST) and lasted around 34 minutes. It was followed by a massive Coronal Mass Ejection (CME).

62.title: No changes made: Google on claims it 'stopped hiding' Russian military facilities
62.article_body: Google has denied claims by many Google Maps users that it has 'stopped hiding' Russia's secret military facilities. Many users shared satellite pics of the facilities saying that they've been 'unblurred', giving anyone a view of the installations and command posts amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We haven't made any blurring changes to our satellite imagery in Russia," said Google.

63.title: Amazon, Reliance, Dream11 & Sony may compete for IPL broadcast rights: Report
63.article_body: Amazon, The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries are among the companies that have signalled an intention to bid for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, Bloomberg reported. Sony, Zee and Dream11 also purchased the bid-related documents from BCCI, it added. BCCI will be conducting the online auction starting June 12.

64.title: Actor Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar, shares pics
64.article_body: Actor Ram Charan on Tuesday visited the Border Security Force (BSF) camp in Amritsar and shared a series of pictures on Instagram. He wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories, sacrifices & dedication of the Border Security Force at the BSF Campus, Khasa Amritsar." In the pictures, Ram can be seen greeting and eating with the soldiers.

65.title: BJP-ruled states should remove loudspeakers from mosques: Ex-VHP chief
65.article_body: Ex-Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Pravin Togadia has said that BJP should remove loudspeakers from mosques in those states where it's in power. "We had demanded...removal of loudspeakers from mosques in Maharashtra some 10 years ago," he added. Togadia's comments come as Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

66.title: Proud to see Gujarat's success: PM Modi on Vidya Samiksha Kendra
66.article_body: While stressing on how children will be benefited from Gujarat’s Vidya Samiksha Kendra, PM Modi said, “The use of such a huge technology for our government primary school is a wonder for the world. It gives great pride to see the success and development of Gujarat.” He also said it can bring big changes in the field of education.

67.title: I found it cute: Srinidhi on Shehnaaz giving away spoiler of KGF 2
67.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actress Srinidhi Shetty, on being asked about Shehnaaz Gill giving away a major spoiler on Twitter, said she "really really found it quite cute". Srinidhi added she initially didn't believe Shehnaaz spoiled it and thought it was a fan page. Shehnaaz praised Srinidhi's performance, writing, "You deserve the compliments since you took a bullet for Rocky bhai."

68.title: Naxals set fire to 7 vehicles engaged in mining in Chhattisgarh
68.article_body: Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur allegedly burned down seven vehicles involved in sand mining. "There was sand mining going on in the Mingachal river, where six to seven vehicles were set on fire by several Naxals," P Sundarraj, IG Bastar, said. Four Hyva trucks, two JCBs were amongst the seven vehicles engaged in sand mining activities in the area.

69.title: 5 accused in Jahangirpuri violence charged under National Security Act
69.article_body: Five accused in Jahangirpuri violence have been charged under the stringent National Security Act, which allows detention for up to one year without any charge. Clashes broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday. Police had said that stones were pelted and several vehicles were set ablaze during the clashes.

70.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as HDFC drops out of the list?
70.article_body: Reliance Industries is India's most valuable company with a market value of ₹17.84 lakh crore, followed by TCS (₹12.71 lakh crore) and HDFC Bank (₹7.44 lakh crore). The list includes Infosys, ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, SBI, Adani Green Energy and Bajaj Finance. Bharti Airtel is India's 10th most valuable company after HDFC Ltd dropped out of the list on Tuesday.

71.title: In talks with India to find solution on payments: Russian diplomat
71.article_body: Consul General of Russia in Mumbai AV Surovtsev said Russia is in talks with the Indian government and Reserve Bank of India to find a solution on the payments front. Due to its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has been cut off from the international payments system SWIFT. "Complicated situation" created by the sanctions creates room for Indian exports, Surovtsev added.

72.title: Sreenivasan discharged from hospital after cardiac arrest treatment
72.article_body: Malayalam actor Sreenivasan was discharged from Apollo Adlux Hospital in Kerala's Angamaly on Tuesday following bypass surgery as treatment for cardiac arrest. The 66-year-old was admitted to the hospital on March 30 after complaining of chest pain. A medical bulletin issued by the hospital stated that Sreenivasan is stable and showed remarkable improvement in his cardiac and general condition.

73.title: I am closest to Ishan Kishan in MI team: Suryakumar Yadav
73.article_body: On being asked to name his friends in MI, Suryakumar Yadav said he's "closest" to Ishan Kishan. "You've to have him around, whether you've won or lost...he can start up a conversation out of anything," he added. "We don't talk about cricket when we bat together," he further said. Suryakumar and Ishan are bottom-placed MI's top-two run-scorers in IPL 2022.

74.title: Formula One is in a good place commercially: Haas team boss Steiner
74.article_body: Haas team boss Gunther Steiner said Formula One is "in a good place commercially" following the addition of Las Vegas as a race venue from 2023 onwards. "In general, Formula One is in a good place commercially. There are a lot of places that want a race, we can almost choose where we want to go," Steiner said.

75.title: Man arrested for giving pistol to an accused in Jahangirpuri violence
75.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a person named 'Gulli' for allegedly giving a pistol to an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence case. The police also arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. Drones are being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after the violence, reports said.

76.title: Burning of Sri Lankan man's body by Pak mob anti-Islam: Court
76.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Tuesday said that the lynching of a Sri Lankan man and the burning of his body by a mob was an act against Islam. "The Holy Prophet...forbade Muslims to disgrace the dead body of even a non-Muslim," it added. The court on Monday convicted 89 people in a mass trial over the crime.

77.title: Singapore & New Zealand to jointly tackle climate change: Leaders
77.article_body: Singapore and New Zealand will jointly tackle climate change by cooperating on green technologies, Prime Ministers from both countries, Lee Hsien Loong and Jacinda Ardern, said on Tuesday. The countries will adopt initiatives around energy transition technology, sustainable transport and waste management, Lee added. "We cannot...simply return to a high carbon emissions...approach," Ardern stated.

78.title: Kendrick Lamar announces new album after 5 years, Twitter users react
78.article_body: After a gap of five years, rapper Kendrick Lamar announced on Twitter that his new album 'Mr Morale & the Big Steppers' will release on May 13. He added the link oklama.com containing details of the album to an old tweet that read, "Lamar is officially retired." "IT'S HAPPENING," a Twitter user wrote. His last album 'DAMN' released in 2017.

79.title: Virat Kohli gets out for a golden duck, IPL share video of his reaction
79.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. IPL shared a video of his dismissal. In the video, Kohli can be seen reacting to his dismissal with a dejected smile. It is Kohli's fourth golden duck in IPL.

80.title: Cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme busted in Bengaluru, 4 arrested
80.article_body: The Bengaluru Crime Branch arrested four people for their alleged involvement in running a Helium Crypto Token (HNT) through a mobile application. Around ₹15 crore was routed through 44 different bank accounts among other items, the police said. "₹78 lakh in cash, 44 Digital Signature Certificate tokens, five company seals, mobile phones, and laptops were seized," they added.

81.title: 23 people killed due to severe storms and lightning in Assam
81.article_body: At least 23 people were killed due to severe storms and lightning in separate incidents over the last few days in Assam and the state has promised compensation to the family of the deceased. "In the last three days, 22 districts reported [such] incidents in...over 1,591 villages, impacting [over] one lakh people," an official of state disaster management authority said.

82.title: Delhi Police under pressure from 'secular, Muslim' leaders: VHP
82.article_body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Tuesday accused the Delhi Police of coming under pressure from "secular and Muslim leaders" to book the organisation in connection with the Jahangirpuri clashes. It also said that Delhi Commissioner of Police Rakesh Asthana's statement that it had not taken permission to take out the 'shobha yatra' through the area was "baseless".

83.title: People throw coins in theatre during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening, Raveena shares video
83.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon on Tuesday took to social media to share a clip of people throwing coins in a theatre screening 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "After a long time seeing coins flying on to the screen! #flashingsilver!" she wrote in the caption. "It's a rage...Thank you for the love," Raveena's post further read.

84.title: I've become more expressive after 'Bigg Boss 15': Karan Kundrra
84.article_body: Karan Kundrra, speaking about life after 'Bigg Boss 15', has said that he has become more expressive. Karan added, "A lot has changed...I am not scared of talking because...I have an image." "Everybody thought that I am this arrogant, strict, angry person, like Roadies...Then people realise that he is not," he stated. Karan was the second runner-up in the show.

85.title: Expecting method acting in commercial films is dumb: Nawazuddin
85.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview has stated if you expect to use method acting in commercial films, then you are dumb. He further said that such films are for fun and the audience comes to enjoy. "If you...dissect my performances, maybe you'll find a lot of flaws. But if you take it as pure fun, one would...enjoy," Nawazuddin added.

86.title: Most important 3 points in your life: Klopp on match against Man Utd
86.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said his players must treat the match against Manchester United on Tuesday like "it is the most important three points in your life". Liverpool trail Manchester City by one point in the Premier League with seven games left. "We have to be angry in a good way and all these kind of things," Klopp added.

87.title: BJP using riots as tool to win civic body polls in Delhi: Sanjay Raut
87.article_body: In an apparent reference to Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the BJP has to win elections through riots and do politics. Raut said, "Delhi is UT...The law-and-order is [being] taken care of by the Center...But since the last few days, there've been riots." "[Reason] behind this is the civic body polls," he added.

88.title: War-disabled soldiers must be treated with respect: Ex-VC of Army
88.article_body: Lieutenant General Vijay Oberoi (retd), former Vice-Chief of Army Staff, has demanded better treatment of war-disabled soldiers. He stated that they must be treated "with great respect and should be adequately compensated", otherwise as soldiers take a "conscious decision" to go to war, the future generation will think twice before risking their lives in service of the nation.

89.title: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö tests positive for COVID-19
89.article_body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö has tested positive for COVID-19, his office said in a statement on Tuesday. "Despite the infection, President Niinistö is well and continuing to work remotely," it added. Niinistö's official visit to Norway to discuss the conflict in Ukraine and European security from April 21 to 22 has been postponed.

90.title: Thief dances after robbing hardware store in UP, CCTV footage goes viral
90.article_body: A person robbing a hardware store in UP's Chandauli was caught dancing after committing the crime. CCTV footage of the incident that took place on Friday night has gone viral online. It shows the thief's face covered with a white cloth and he's seen dancing while facing the CCTV camera before escaping through the store's shutter.

91.title: That feels very proud too: Madhavan on being called Vedaant's father
91.article_body: Actor R Madhavan on Tuesday responded to writer Anand Ranganathan's tweet about his upcoming film 'Rocketry' referring to him as Vedaant Madhavan's father. The actor wrote, "Somehow that felt very proud too. Thank you chief." Vedaant won gold medal in the men's 800m freestyle event and silver medal in the 1500m freestyle swimming event at the Danish Open in Copenhagen.

92.title: Punjab women's college management suspended over ₹11 cr funds misuse
92.article_body: The management of Punjab's Akal Degree College for Women has been placed under suspension by the state government over the alleged misuse of funds amounting to ₹11.86 crore. A probe by the state higher education department reportedly found that the managing committee of the Sangrur college had transferred the amount to another college and used it to start self-finance courses.

93.title: 6 killed as SUV and bus collide in UP's Deoria
93.article_body: Six people were killed and 12 were injured after an SUV collided with a bus in Deoria, Uttar Pradesh. The accident took place when the occupants of the SUV were returning from a marriage function, the police said. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the incident and directed officials to provide proper treatment to the injured.

94.title: TRS leader's son held for kidnaping, raping 20-yr-old after drugging her in T'gana
94.article_body: TRS ward councillor Mohammed Khaja's son Sheik Ghouse Pasha and his friend have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and gang-raping a 20-year-old woman for two days after drugging her in Telangana's Kodad. The woman alleged when she regained consciousness, she escaped and informed her family about the incident. She added she was beaten up so badly that she was unconscious.

95.title: Nani marks 3yrs of National Award-winning 'Jersey', shares deleted scene
95.article_body: Telugu actor Nani on Tuesday celebrated three years since the release of his National Award-winning film 'Jersey' by sharing a deleted scene from the film. The actor wrote, "This was one of (director) Gowtam Tinnanuri's favourite but couldn't make it to the cut." The scene depicts Nani's character being offered money by his wife's father and being called a loser.

96.title: If things are wrong, they shouldn't be sold: Ajay on criticism over endorsements
96.article_body: Ajay Devgn, speaking about criticism over endorsements, said if certain things are so wrong, they shouldn't be sold. "It's a personal choice. When you do something, you also see how harmful it would be. Some things are harmful, some aren't," he added. Earlier, Akshay Kumar was criticised for joining Ajay and Shah Rukh Khan in endorsing a pan masala brand.

97.title: Probe ordered against Assam CM Sarma ahead of Guwahati civic polls
97.article_body: Assam State Election Commission has instructed to initiate a probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma for alleged model code violations during campaigns for Guwahati civic polls. A complaint was filed by Asom Jatiya Parishad (AJP) president Sanjeev Bora against Sarma, accusing him of promising 'land patta' to landless residents. The complaint further alleged that Sarma sought to bribe wards.

98.title: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast sharply from 9% to 8.2% for FY23
98.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has sharply cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 8.2% from 9%, citing Russia-Ukraine war. "Economic damage from the conflict will contribute to a significant slowdown in global growth in 2022 and add to inflation," the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook report. IMF cut its global growth outlook for 2022 to 3.6%.

99.title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 clash, both sides unchanged
99.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are fielding the same playing XIs they fielded in their previous respective matches. LSG are currently third on the points table, while RCB are fourth.

100.title: 1 killed & 10 injured as Sri Lankan police fire at anti-govt protesters
100.article_body: At least one person was killed and around 10 people were injured after police fired at anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka's Rambukkana, reports said on Tuesday. As per reports, police said that protesters had attempted to set fire to a fuel bowser. Sri Lanka has seen widespread protests amid the worst economic crisis the country has seen since independence.

101.title: Dhawan is in form of his life, he's 'Mr IPL' for me: Swann
101.article_body: Calling Shikhar Dhawan "Mr IPL", Graeme Swann said the PBKS opener is in the form of his life. "I love watching every minute of him bat like that," he added. "He's been playing a pink suit gear dog in...[ongoing] IPL," he further said. Shikhar is PBKS' second-highest run-scorer, having scored 205 runs thus far this season in six matches.

102.title: Russia seeks medical equipment from India amid war
102.article_body: Russia is seeking more medical equipment from India after several countries imposed sanctions on Russia after its decision to invade Ukraine, according to Bloomberg. Indian and Russian firms will discuss ways to increase supplies during a meeting on April 22, Rajiv Nath, the Association of Indian Medical Device Industry's coordinator said.

103.title: Main accused in Jahangirpuri violence a BJP leader: AAP MLA Atishi
103.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, is a BJP leader. "It is clear that the BJP is behind the Jahangirpuri riots and it should apologise to the people of Delhi. BJP is a party of hooligans," AAP's Atishi said in a tweet.

104.title: Auditioned for 'X-Factor' as I wanted to marry Harry Styles: Camila
104.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello has revealed she auditioned for reality show 'X-Factor' because she wanted to marry singer Harry Styles. "This is really embarrassing and I can only say this because it's like 10 years ago...I really believed that at the time," she added. Camila further said she thought they'll meet, she'll become a singer and they'll probably fall in love.

105.title: I hate Shang-Chi comics, character is not fleshed out: Simu Liu
105.article_body: Actor Simu Liu has revealed that he hates certain Shang-Chi comics due to the way the stories involving the Chinese-American superhero were written. Simu added that the comics were written by white men who didn't understand an authentic Asian-American experience. "[Shang-Chi in the comics] was very serious, spoke mostly in mystical proverbs and didn't feel fleshed out," the actor said.

106.title: He'll become unplayable bowler, play for India: Gavaskar on SRH pacer Umran
106.article_body: Seeing SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling performance in ongoing IPL, Sunil Gavaskar said the 22-year-old is going to play for India soon. He added that Umran's accuracy has been more impressive than his speed. "If he bowls wicket-to-wicket, he's pretty much going to become an unplayable bowler," he further said. Umran has taken nine wickets from six matches so far.

107.title: HC grants interim relief to Khadse's wife in Pune land scam case
107.article_body: The Bombay High Court has granted interim relief to senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Eknath Khadse in the Pune land scam case. The next hearing will take place on April 25, Mandakini's advocate Mohan Tekavde said. The case is related to the alleged money laundering pertaining to a land at Bhosari in Pune.

108.title: No one is indispensable: Cong MP Bordoloi on Ripun Bora joining TMC
108.article_body: Congress MP Pradyut Bordoloi reacted to ex-Assam party unit chief Ripun Bora's recent switchover to Trinamool Congress (TMC), terming the move "unfortunate", adding that "nobody is indispensable". Bordoloi added that the Congress "has very strong DNA" in Assam and wasn't dependent on Bora's support. Bora has said that only the TMC is capable of fighting against BJP.

109.title: Once heard an actress' mom say 'Be nice, he's big producer': Poonam
109.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon has revealed she once heard the mother of an actress tell her to be nice to a man because he is a big producer. "You have to be nice to everyone, your driver, make-up artist, producer, director...If a parent pressures the daughter to be 'nice' to a producer, obviously you're asking her to compromise," Poonam added.

110.title: Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate jumped 3-fold between April 11-18
110.article_body: The COVID-19 positivity rate in Delhi registered a nearly three-fold rise between April 11 and 18, according to data released by Delhi's health department. While the positivity rate stood at 2.7% on April 11, it jumped to 7.72% on April 18. Last week, Delhi recorded 2,606 COVID-19 positive cases against 67,360 tests with an average positivity rate of 4.79%.

111.title: Kajal Aggarwal and Gautam Kitchlu blessed with a baby boy
111.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu welcomed a baby boy on Tuesday morning, Kajal's sister Nisha Aggarwal told Indian Express. She also shared that both the mother and the baby are doing well and are healthy. Kajal and Gautam got married in October 2020 and Gautam had announced earlier this year that they are set to become parents.

112.title: Pic shows bags full of cats & dogs in China as police kill pets of COVID +ve owners
112.article_body: Pictures and videos of bags full of cats and dogs on a pavement in China's Shanghai amid COVID-19 lockdown are being widely circulated online. Police in the city are allegedly torturing and killing the pets of owners who have tested positive for COVID-19. Earlier, a video showing a health worker beating a pet dog to death also surfaced online.

113.title: I used to be insomniac, now I'm early morning person: Shahid Kapoor
113.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his sleeping habits, said that he wakes up early. Shahid further stated that if he has a shoot at 8-9 am, he wakes up 3.5 hours before it. "I used to be an insomniac. Now I'm a very early morning person...I love morning energy and by 6-6.30 in the evening I am out," Shahid added.

114.title: Mumbai to soon become India's first city to get a 100% digital bus
114.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) on Tuesday released a video on its Twitter handle showing the demo of India's first fully digital bus. For boarding and de-boarding, passengers can either flash their smartcards in front of a machine fixed at the bus' rear entrance or use the 'Chalo' mobile app. The fare will automatically be deducted when de-boarding.

115.title: Boy addicted to games kills self as father fails to recharge internet in MP
115.article_body: A 14-year-old boy allegedly hanged himself from the ceiling fan of his home after his father, who works as a labourer, was unable to recharge his mobile internet in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. Police said the man was facing financial problems. The boy was addicted to playing games on the mobile phone, City Superintendent of Police (CSP) Alok Sharma said.

116.title: Bhushan Kumar's attempts show his thirst to get rid of rape case: Mumbai court
116.article_body: A Mumbai magistrate's court said producer Bhushan Kumar, who was accused in a rape case, has "no locus standi to address...court but he has attempted to contest the matter which is...unethical". "His attempts show his...thirst to get rid of the matter," the court said. It rejected police's closure report and directed them to probe the matter as per law.

117.title: Reliance Brands acquires 51% majority stake in Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla
117.article_body: Reliance Brands Limited (RBL) has acquired a majority stake in luxury fashion label Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla. RBL has signed a definitive agreement to invest in the prominent couture brand for a 51% stake. The company has recently set up a ready-to-wear fashion venture with Delhi-based designer Rahul Mishra and also acquired a 40% stake in Manish Malhotra.

118.title: Nani was outstanding in 'Jersey', I cried watching him in it: Shahid
118.article_body: Shahid Kapoor has revealed that he cried watching actor Nani's performance in the 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey'. "Nani was outstanding in the film. He is younger, so for him to have played the father was, kudos to him for pulling it off," he stated. Shahid will star in the Hindi remake of the film which will release on April 22.

119.title: Barcelona suffer 0-1 loss to relegation-threatened Cadiz in La Liga
119.article_body: Barcelona on Monday suffered a shock 0-1 defeat at home to relegation-threatened Cadiz in La Liga. Barcelona are now 15 points behind leaders Real Madrid. "It's a very bad week for us  and we need to change the dynamic as soon as possible," manager Xavi said. Barcelona exited the UEFA Europa League after losing to Eintracht Frankfurt last week.

120.title: Man rapes, blackmails woman by using obscene videos in Gurugram
120.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing a 30-year-old woman by using her objectionable videos in Gurugram, police said on Tuesday. The accused made a video of the woman bathing some time back and used it to threaten and rape her on different occasions, police said. The survivor informed her sister after which a case was registered.

121.title: Sri Lankan Prez admits mistakes led to severe economic crisis
121.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said he made mistakes that led to the severe economic crisis in the country and pledged to correct them. "Today, people are under immense pressure due to this economic crisis. I deeply regret this situation," he added. Rajapaksa made the remarks while speaking to the new Cabinet ministers appointed by him.

122.title: Lithuania bans usage of letter 'Z' amid Russian invasion of Ukraine
122.article_body: Lithuania on Tuesday banned the public displays of the letter 'Z' and other signs that symbolise support for Russia amid Ukraine's invasion. The letter 'Z' has been used as a marking on Russian military equipment participating in the war. Lithuanian lawmakers have also reportedly approved that fines for breaching the ban should be raised to €900 for individuals (over ₹74,000).

123.title: 10 dead, 8 injured in road crash in Rajasthan, CM expresses grief
123.article_body: Ten members of a family were killed after the jeep they were travelling in crashed with a parked tractor trolley in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district on Tuesday. Eight others were also injured in the crash which took place on the Jhunjhunu-Gudha Godji highway in the afternoon, police said. CM Ashok Gehlot has expressed his deepest condolences over the incident.

124.title: Adi Chopra said before debut 'You're not Hrithik, do acting': Ranveer
124.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that filmmaker Aditya Chopra told him before his debut, "You're not Hrithik Roshan, toh tu acting kar lena (so you do acting)." The actor added that he once saw two people standing in front of his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat' poster. "They said, 'Who is this? He doesn't look like a hero!'" Ranveer said.

125.title: Man Utd’s Bruno Fernandes uninjured after being involved in car crash
125.article_body: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes on Monday escaped uninjured after being involved in a car crash. All parties involved in the crash escaped without any serious injuries. The Portuguese midfielder was able to train ahead of Manchester United's match with Liverpool in the Premier League on Tuesday. "He was okay and he'll be okay for tomorrow," interim manager Ralf Rangnick said.

126.title: It’s not rocket science: Man Utd boss Rangnick on transfer windows
126.article_body: Manchester United's interim boss Ralf Rangnick on Monday said the club needs a couple of transfer windows to rebuild success, adding that getting it right is "not rocket science". "If you know what you are looking for it will take two or three transfer windows," he said. "It's not that complicated, it's not rocket science," he added.

127.title: Jahangirpuri violence effort to tarnish image of country, PM: BJP MP
127.article_body: BJP MP from North West Delhi Hans Raj Hans said that the Jahangirpuri violence was an effort to tarnish the image of the country and PM Narendra Modi before Boris Johnson's visit. "The Prime Minister is continuously trying to make India the number one country in the world. He has become an international personality," he said.

128.title: No need to panic for now: Sisodia amid rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi
128.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said that there is no need to panic for now, adding that "we'll have to learn to live with COVID-19 as it'll stay in some capacity". Sisodia added the Delhi government will take strict action if COVID-19 cases increase more. DDMA will hold a meeting tomorrow over the same.

129.title: 3 killed in Arunachal Pradesh after heavy rains trigger landslide
129.article_body: Three persons, including a nine-year-old child, were killed in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey district after heavy rains caused a massive landslide. The victims were buried alive in Monday's incident which also damaged at least 15 houses, an official said. The state has been receiving continuous rainfall for over a week causing road connectivity to be disrupted in several areas.

130.title: 22-yr-old BTech student found dead in his house in J'khand, probe on
130.article_body: A third-year BTech student was found dead in his house in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Monday. Police believe that the deceased, Vijay Mahto, died by suicide over an affair. However, his parents have reportedly claimed the 22-year-old was dumped on the roof after being beaten to death and have also named some people they suspect. Police are investigating the allegations.

131.title: HDFC no longer among India's top 10 most valuable companies
131.article_body: India's largest housing finance company HDFC Ltd is no longer among the top 10 most valuable companies of India in terms of market capitalisation. The shares of HDFC have plunged nearly 19% after the announcement of its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month. Meanwhile, HDFC Bank is the third most valuable company of India after Reliance Industries and TCS.

132.title: Tactically he never had it: Boycott on Root's Test captaincy
132.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott said Joe Root never had the tactical ability to be England's Test skipper. He added Root didn't have the instinct for changing situations in the match. "Captaincy is tactical awareness and man management of players," he further said. Root led England in 64 Tests, won 27 and lost 26, both a record for an English captain.

133.title: Delhi govt should take over Rohini ashram housing women improperly: HC
133.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday said the Delhi government's health department should take over the Adhyatmik Vidyalaya, an ashram in Rohini, housing women in "animal-like conditions". "We find it difficult to accept that the inmates of the institution are in their full senses and that they are [there] of their own free will," the HC said.

134.title: Man arrested for allegedly raping his 14-year-old daughter in Delhi
134.article_body: A 45-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his 14-year-old daughter in Delhi, police said on Tuesday. According to Superintendent of Police Hemraj Meena, the man allegedly raped his daughter at their house. The girl's brother filed a complaint against the accused, following which the police arrested the man, the police officer added.

135.title: Fire breaks out at powerhouse in Ghaziabad; fire tenders rushed to spot
135.article_body: A fire broke out at Niti Khand Indirapuram's powerhouse on Tuesday. Ghaziabad Police informed that local police, fire department are on the spot and efforts are on to bring the fire under control. In another incident, a fire broke out at a shop in West Delhi's Kirti Nagar furniture market on Tuesday, ANI reported, citing Delhi Fire Service officials.

136.title: Not guaranteed that Macron will win French presidential polls: PM
136.article_body: France PM Jean Castex said on Tuesday that Emmanuel Macron wasn't guaranteed to win the runoff in the presidential election on April 24 against his political opponent Marine Le Pen. Macron and Le Pen secured the most votes in the first round of elections. Notably, Castex has also said that he'll tender his resignation if Macron is re-elected as President.

137.title: 22-yr-old woman slashes fiancé's throat after calling him for 'surprise date' in Andhra
137.article_body: A 22-year-old woman in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam allegedly slashed her fiancé's throat a month ahead of their marriage after calling him for a 'surprise date'. The man, who is a scientist with the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research, has been hospitalised. Police said the woman confessed to the crime, adding that she was being forced to marry him.

138.title: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif's 37-member Cabinet sworn in
138.article_body: The 37-member Cabinet of newly-elected Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif took oath during a brief ceremony on Tuesday. The new Cabinet includes members of political parties allied with Sharif's PML-N. Senate Chairman Sadiq Sanjrani had administered the oath after President Arif Alvi, an ally of ex-PM Imran Khan, excused himself reportedly citing his health.

139.title: Max temperature in Hyderabad likely to touch 40°C in next 2 days: IMD
139.article_body: India Meteorological Department has predicted that the maximum temperature in Hyderabad is likely to touch 40 degrees Celsius in the next two days. However, the weather department has also predicted a partly cloudy sky with the possibility of rain or thunderstorm in the city. According to the IMD, the city reported a maximum temperature of 39 degrees Celsius on Monday.

140.title: Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover opens for public; to ease traffic congestion
140.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao and Mohammed Mahmood Ali inaugurated the six-lane bi-directional flyover at Bahadurpura in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park, which has been constructed at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore, is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi was also present during the inauguration.

141.title: Japan fast food chain fires MD for saying 'get virgins' addicted to their food
141.article_body: Japan's fast-food chain Yoshinoya, known for its inexpensive bowls of beef on rice, has fired its managing director over his alleged derogatory remarks toward women. Masaki Ito during a university lecture apparently said that the company should try to "get virgins addicted" to Yoshinoya’s food because "once men treat them to expensive meals they won't eat beef bowls anymore".

142.title: Villagers stage protest against toll plaza in Gurugram
142.article_body: Residents of villages along the Sohna road on Monday protested at the Ghamroj toll plaza in Gurugram, demanding an exemption from paying the toll tax. The protesters also threatened to raze toll plaza if the toll is not made free for locals by Wednesday. A resident said, "(Nitin) Gadkari...said that nearby residents will get free passes but we're being charged."

143.title: 'Kem cho? Majama?', says WHO chief as PM Modi applauds; video surfaces
143.article_body: A video has shown WHO Director-General Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus talking in Gujarati during an event in Jamnagar. The video shows Ghebreyesus saying, "Kem cho? Majama? (How are you? Fine?)", while PM Narendra Modi is seen laughing and applauding. He was speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine.

144.title: Didn't do rom-coms for 20 yrs, scripts weren't good: Julia Roberts
144.article_body: Actress Julia Roberts has revealed that she has not done romantic-comedy films in the last 20 years because there wasn't a single good script. "If I'd read something that...was that 'Notting Hill'...or 'My Best Friend's Wedding' level...I would do it," she added. Julia further said that she has three children and has to work with her husband and children's schedules.

145.title: Gambhir said 'Look at your initials': Suryakumar Yadav on how he got nickname 'SKY'
145.article_body: Talking about how he got nickname 'SKY', batter Suryakumar Yadav revealed that when he was with KKR in 2014, Gautam Gambhir started calling him 'SKY' but he didn't pay attention. "Gambhir said, 'I am calling you only. Check your initials.' Then I realised it's 'SKY'," Suryakumar said. Suryakumar played for KKR from 2014 to 2017.

146.title: President gives assent to Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill
146.article_body: President of India Ram Nath Kovind has given his assent to the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, which allows police to obtain physical and biological samples of convicts and those accused of crimes. Moreover, it also empowers a magistrate to order measurements or photographs of a person to be taken to aid the investigation of an offence.

147.title: Your pain is our pain: Manchester United to Ronaldo after his newborn son passes away
147.article_body: After Cristiano Ronaldo announced the death of his newborn son, Manchester United tweeted, "Your pain is our pain." The club further said in a statement, "Family is more important than everything and Ronaldo is supporting his loved ones at this immensely difficult time...We can confirm he will not feature in the match against Liverpool at Anfield on Tuesday evening."

148.title: PM inaugurates new dairy complex, potato processing plant in Gujarat
148.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today inaugurated a new dairy complex and a potato processing plant, which is built at a cost of over ₹600 crore, at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. "Initiatives at Banas Dairy will empower farmers and boost...rural economy," PM tweeted. The dairy complex will enable the processing of about 30 lakh litres of milk daily, PMO stated.

149.title: 'KGF 2' collects ₹600 cr globally, becomes 9th highest-grossing Indian film
149.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has collected over ₹600 crore globally within five days of its release and has become the ninth highest-grossing Indian film of all time, as per film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Hindi-dubbed version of the Yash-starrer has earned over ₹200 crore domestically. The film is directed by Prashanth Neel.

150.title: Govt revising all testing norms for EV batteries & cells: Reports
150.article_body: The government is revising all testing norms for batteries, battery management and cells after multiple EV scooters caught fire across India, CNBC-TV18 reported. The government is holding a dialogue with companies connected with the fire incidents. Okinawa, Ola, Jitendra Electric and Pure EV are being advised on steps that need to be taken to prevent such fires in future.

151.title: UP govt allots land, houses to 63 Hindu families displaced from Bangladesh
151.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday allotted houses, agricultural land and residential plots to 63 Hindu families, displaced from East Pakistan, now called Bangladesh, in the 1970s. A total of 65 families were to be given rehabilitation after the yarn mill they were working in was closed in 1984. "Your 38-year-long wait is over today," CM Yogi Adityanath said.

152.title: 2 men try to drive into Mauritius PM's convoy in Mumbai; arrested
152.article_body: Two men, who were allegedly drunk, tried to drive into the convoy of Mauritius PM Pravind Kumar Jugnauth in Mumbai's Mahim Causeway in the early hours of Monday. Police said the men appeared drunk but their medical report is yet to come. The convoy was moving from the Western Expressway Highway towards Bandra Worli sea link.

153.title: Centre procures 69 lakh metric tonnes of wheat in current season
153.article_body: The Centre has procured 69.24 lakh metric tonnes (LMT) of wheat, with an MSP value of ₹13,951 crore, till April 17 during the rabi marketing season (RMS) 2022-23, Union Ministry's officials said. According to them, the wheat procurement has benefitted nearly 5.86 lakh farmers this season. The MSP of wheat for the RMS 2022-23 is ₹2,015 per quintal.

154.title: Cyberspace threats directly impact India's national security: Doval
154.article_body: NSA Ajit Doval said cyberspace threats directly impact India's social, economic and national security. A digital revolution is taking place across India, Doval said while speaking at a cybersecurity training workshop's inauguration. Also present at the event, National Cybersecurity Coordinator Lt Gen Rajesh Pant said, "The [Centre] is taking various steps to build capacities...in cybersecurity."

155.title: Ready to take in at least 10,000 injured Ukrainian soldiers: Poland
155.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said Poland is ready to take in and treat at least 10,000 injured Ukrainian soldiers. Poland is already treating "several dozen" soldiers, Morawiecki said during a visit to Ukraine's Lviv city. Last week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said up to 3,000 Ukrainian troops have died and 10,000 soldiers have been injured in the war so far.

156.title: Indian economy not immune to Ukraine war, inflation on the cards: RBI
156.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said as the Russia-Ukraine war continues to affect the global supply chain and inflate prices, the Indian economy is expected to not remain immune either. India's high inflation and widening trade deficit are expected to hamper growth and lead to "rocketing inflation", RBI added. Retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of 6.95% in March.

157.title: Gorilla addicted to smartphones has his screen time cut down in US zoo
157.article_body: A 16-year-old gorilla, who developed a smartphone addiction after being shown pictures and videos by visitors at a US zoo, is having his screen time cut down. Amare, due to his addiction, had reportedly failed to notice as another gorilla had charged at him. Zoo authorities have now put up a rope to keep visitors away from his enclosure.

158.title: Drew references from my mom for 'Jersey' role: Mrunal Thakur
158.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur has revealed that she plays a mother in Shahid Kapoor-starrer upcoming film 'Jersey', adding that it is something she hasn't really experienced in real life. "So I drew references from my mother for the part," the actress said. Mrunal further said that she has waited for the film to hit the big screen for a long time.

159.title: I didn't see a screenplay in 'Beast': Vijay's father SA Chandrasekhar
159.article_body: Talking about his son and actor Vijay's film 'Beast', director SA Chandrasekhar said he couldn't see a screenplay in the movie, adding that the film was made "solely" on Vijay's stardom. "The magic is there in the screenplay. You can't lightly handle a very heavy subject which is about international terrorist organisations. The director has to...study it," added Chandrasekhar.

160.title: SC reconstitutes monitoring committee in Delhi-Doon corridor project
160.article_body: The expert committee to monitor the compensatory afforestation in the Delhi-Dehradun Economic corridor project was reconstituted by the Supreme Court on Tuesday. The bench directed that the chairperson of the committee will be the Director-General Forests, Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change. Notably, the project will reduce the travel time between Delhi and Dehradun to 2.5 hours.

161.title: CoBRA commando injured in encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh
161.article_body: A commando of CRPF's CoBRA unit was injured in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Tuesday. The gunfight took place in the forest between Kottaguda and Pegdapalli villages, where joint teams of security forces were on a search operation, IGP Sundarraj P said. The injured commando, identified as Sanjeev Kumar, is currently being treated.

162.title: Jahangirpuri violence a criminal conspiracy: Police in report to MHA
162.article_body: The Delhi Police on Tuesday submitted the preliminary report to Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. Police said the violence was a part of criminal conspiracy. In the report, the police mentioned immediate steps taken by the forces to control the situation.

163.title: Since April 15, life has been about baby crying, no sleep: Mohena on son's birth
163.article_body: 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress Mohena Kumari took to Instagram to share post after the birth of her son on April 15. "These last few days have gone by so fast...Since the 15th of April...life has been all about...hospital bed, baby nurses...baby feeding, baby crying...baby pacifying, no sleep, medicines and of course recovery," she wrote.

164.title: I ran away from home to pursue acting: 'Arjun Reddy' actress Shalini
164.article_body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who made her acting debut with Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy' said she ran away from home to pursue acting. "Dad wasn't convinced to let me [become an actress]. I was trying to convince him for four years but he wasn't letting me pursue it," added Shalini. Shalini will be seen in the upcoming Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'.

165.title: Leaked pictures of Prabhas from 'Salaar' sets surface online
165.article_body: Two pictures of actor Prabhas from the sets of his upcoming film 'Salaar' have been leaked online. The film is directed and written by Prashanth Neel, who has directed the 'KGF' franchise. Actress Shruti Haasan is the female lead in the film and actor Prithviraj will also feature in the film. The film's release date is yet to be announced.

166.title: Growing stronger: Tahira shares a video lifting heavy weights after 3.5 yrs
166.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife, author Tahira Kashyap Khurrana shared a glimpse of her workout video. Her latest video shows her regaining her strength and lifting heavy weights after three and a half years. Sharing the video, Tahira wrote, "Growing stronger! Being able to lift this much after 3.5 years." Taking to the comments section, actress Shilpa Shetty commented, "Daaanggg."

167.title: SRK to work with Rajkumar Hirani for first time, announces film 'Dunki'
167.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce his new film 'Dunki' with filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani. "Dear @RajkumarHirani sir, you turned out to be my Santa Claus...you start [film], I'll reach on time...actually I will start living on the set...Feeling humbled & excited to finally work with you...Bringing to you all #Dunki...in cinemas on 22nd December 2023," he wrote.

168.title: Hijab won't be allowed during K'taka II PUC exams: Education Minister
168.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said that hijabs won't be allowed during the II Pre-University Course Examination. "All students must follow rules on uniform, hijab cladding students won't be allowed," he said. The row over hijab began in December 2021, when six female students of Government PU College for Girls in Udupi were not allowed to attend classes wearing headscarves.

169.title: Karthik can be used as a finisher in the upcoming T20 WC: Gavaskar
169.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that RCB batter Dinesh Karthik can play the finisher's role for India in this year's T20 World Cup. "He's (Karthik) just changing the complexion of the game with his performance. He's doing the job that you can expect him to do at number 6 or 7 at the (T20) World Cup," Gavaskar said.

170.title: 'Feeling good,' says McCoy after bowling a match-winning final over vs KKR
170.article_body: Rajasthan Royals pacer Obed McCoy said that he "felt good" after the match against KKR in which the West Indian defended 11 runs in the final over and led RR to a victory. "This is my first game since last year...had come under pressure, feeling good, it was just about getting over the nerves and going hard," McCoy said.

171.title: Philippines envoy to China dies aged 74 while in quarantine
171.article_body: The Philippines' Ambassador to China, Jose Santiago "Chito" Sta. Romana, has died aged 74 while he was reportedly in 21-day quarantine in Huangshan city after returning from the Philippines. The Philippine Foreign Affairs Department condoled his death and said the Philippines and China's ties "flourished despite differences" under Sta. Romana's tenure. He was appointed as envoy to China in 2016.

172.title: Auto, taxi drivers call off strike demanding hike in fares in Delhi
172.article_body: Unions representing autorickshaws and taxis have called off strike demanding a hike in fares in Delhi. "If no action is taken in 25 days, then after 25 days we will shut Delhi's total food chain including tempos and trucks," an official said. Autorickshaw and taxi drivers have been demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares.

173.title: Arjun, Bhumi begin shooting for 'The Ladykiller' in Himachal Pradesh
173.article_body: Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar have started shooting for filmmaker Ajay Bahl's next movie, 'The Ladykiller', in Himachal Pradesh. Arjun, while speaking about the forthcoming project, said, "The Ladykiller is one of the most exciting scripts of my career." "I'm thrilled to be collaborating with Bhumi and my director Ajay Bahl for the first time," he added.

174.title: Chiranjeevi reaches for the last rites of producer Narayan Das Narang in Hyderabad
174.article_body: Chiranjeevi reached for the funeral of producer Narayan Das Narang. The actor will pay his respects at the last rites which will reportedly begin in the afternoon. Several celebrities from Tollywood will attend the funeral in Hyderabad. Chiranjeevi also paid tribute to the late producer on Twitter and said he created a niche for himself with his expertise.

175.title: Trying to convince EU to restrict Russian oil supplies: France
175.article_body: France has said that it is trying to convince the members of the European Union (EU) to restrict oil supplies from Russia in view of the Ukraine war.
