"I think everybody should see it about 4-5 times because you will not understand the film in the first go," Sanjay said. The actor was replying to a fan who said that there has been no film of Dutt he hasn't watched in theatres.

351.title: Fan's 'marriage proposal' poster for KKR captain Shreyas Iyer goes viral
351.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a 'marriage proposal' poster for KKR captain Shreyas Iyer ahead of KKR-RR match has gone viral. "My mom has asked me to find a guy. So, will you marry me, Shreyas Iyer?" the poster read. Sharing the picture, KKR wrote, "That's one way of shooting your shot!"

352.title: Which RR bowlers have taken hat-trick in IPL history?
352.article_body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on Monday became the fifth Rajasthan Royals (RR) bowler to take a hat-trick in IPL history. Ajit Chandila had become the first RR bowler to take an IPL hat-trick in 2012. Pravin Tambe and Shane Watson took hat-trick against KKR and SRH, respectively, in 2014. Shreyas Gopal took a hat-trick in 2019 against RCB.

353.title: Man assumes wife acted in porn film he watched, kills her in front of kids in B'luru
353.article_body: A 40-year-old Bengaluru man killed his wife on Sunday after assuming that she acted in a porn movie that he watched two months ago. The accused named Pasha, an auto driver, allegedly beat up Mubeena at a family function in Kolar two months ago over the same issue. The two had been married for 15 years and have five children.

354.title: Hyd police nab 15 over gambling on rooster fights; ₹29,280 seized
354.article_body: Hyderabad's LB Nagar Special Operations Team has nabbed 15 people who were allegedly organising gambling on rooster fights in the forest area on the outskirts of Adibatla, the police tweeted on Tuesday. The police also recovered ₹29,280 and other items from the accused. The accused tried to escape when they noticed the police team but were caught.

355.title: Body of New York woman found in duffel bag, was stabbed 60 times
355.article_body: Police are looking for the person who stabbed a New York City woman to death and dumped her body in a duffel bag. Orsolya Gaal was killed in the basement of her home by an unidentified attacker, who then dragged her body and left it on a street corner on Saturday. The 51-year-old woman was reportedly stabbed nearly 60 times.

356.title: Lucky to have my kids know what we do: Warner on pics of daughters' reaction to dismissal
356.article_body: DC opener David Warner took to Instagram to share the viral pictures of his daughters 'heartbroken' reaction to his dismissal against RCB. He wrote, "So lucky to have my kids know what we do, but more importantly, it teaches them that you can't always win. We all give 100% every time we walk onto that field, no matter what."

357.title: Maha minister meets Baghel seeking clearances for coal block
357.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nitin Raut has sought clearances for a coal block allocated to a state-run power company in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh. He met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday to urge early completion of the formalities and reportedly sought forest diversion. The Chhattisgarh government said that the CM assured full support in the matter to Raut.

358.title: Why is PM silent on incidents of riots and violence? : Congress' Surjewala
358.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said BJP and its government are at war with its own people. "While parts of India are ravaged by riots and violence, why is the Prime Minister so conspicuously silent? Why does he not denounce hatred no matter where it comes from?" Surjewala added. "Why do perpetrators of hate get political patronage?" Surjewala stated.

359.title: MP man thrashes elder brother to death after being denied ₹100, arrested
359.article_body: Police have arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly thrashing his elder brother to death after being denied ₹100 by him in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, police said on Monday. The incident took place on Sunday evening. Reports said that the accused slammed his brother on the ground several times, which eventually led to his death.

360.title: 14-yr-old Hyderabad boy dies while playing, parents suspect murder
360.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died after he allegedly collapsed while playing volleyball at Moghalpura ground in Hyderabad on Saturday. According to police, preliminary reports suggest that Mohammed Nawaz died due to dehydration. However, his parents suspect it to be a murder. "A few boys playing with Nawaz claimed that others beat him up," Nawaz's father Riaz Ahmed said.

361.title: 28-yr-old man missing since communal clashes in MP's Khargone found dead
361.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who went missing following communal clashes in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone on April 10, has been found dead. The man succumbed to his injuries on April 12, but they hadn't been able to identify him for six days, police said. Police have denied the allegations of the man's family, who claimed that he was killed in police custody.

362.title: SC stays UP govt decision to take back land from Jauhar University
362.article_body: The Supreme Court stayed a decision by UP government to take back land allotted to Rampur’s Mohammad Ali Jauhar University. The university, which is run by a Trust headed by Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan, was allotted 400 acres of land in 2005. The construction of a mosque on the premises violated government's conditions, Allahabad High Court had noted.

363.title: Delhi Police arrests 5 of a family over Jahangirpuri violence
363.article_body: Delhi Police arrested five people and apprehended one minor of the same family in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti. "My husband ran away...to save his life," the wife of an accused said. As many as 23 people have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended so far.

364.title: DFEH rushed to sue us for quick publicity grab: Tesla on racism suit
364.article_body: Tesla has accused the US' DFEH of abandoning its founding purpose, ignoring its statutory obligations and rushing to sue it "perhaps for a quick publicity grab". The agency had alleged Tesla ignored years of complaints about racial slurs in its California factory. Tesla also said the DFEH perhaps feared that US' EEOC would be the first to settle with Tesla.

365.title: 62-yr-old man cheated of ₹16 lakh under pretext of marriage in Pune
365.article_body: A 62-year-old man was allegedly cheated of over ₹16 lakh by a person he met on an online platform under the pretext of getting married. The man had approached the police a few months ago and a case was filed in the matter on Sunday. "[Complainant's] son is betrothed and he was afraid of sharing details," a police sub-inspector said.

366.title: Sri Lanka's state-run oil firm raises petrol prices amid economic crisis
366.article_body: Sri Lanka's state-run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation has raised the price of 92 octane petrol to LKR 338 per litre amid the nation’s worst economic crisis. This comes a day after Indian Oil Company's local operation raised its prices. Notably, this was CPC’s second price hike within a month. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s.

367.title: Fundamentalism more dangerous when practised by majority: Kerala minister
367.article_body: Kerala minister MV Govindan said fundamentalism is more dangerous when practised by the majority than the minority. His remark came in reaction to the killings of RSS and SDPI workers in Palakkad. He added, the majority fundamentalism "is working towards formation of a Hindu Rashtra" and the hatred towards minorities is part of the attempt to create to achieve that.

368.title: High temp, low maintenance behind rise in Delhi's fire incidents: DFS Chief
368.article_body: The Delhi Fire Service (DFS) Chief Atul Garg has said that the soaring temperatures and low fire safety maintenance in public places have led to the "spike in numbers" of Delhi's fire incidents this month. Notably, 2,219 fire calls were reported from Delhi between April 1 and 17. In 2021, the number was 3,240 for the entire April month.

369.title: 21-year-old MBBS student found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh
369.article_body: A 21-year-old MBBS student of Government Medical College and Hospital was found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh's Sector 22, police said. "The incident came to light when her mother visited her...She knocked...didn't receive any response," police added. "The mother said her daughter was scheduled to go to college for taking admission in current semester...she was nervous," police stated.

370.title: Made us proud: Akshay after R Madhavan's son Vedaant wins Gold at Danish Open
370.article_body: After actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant Madhavan bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022, several actors including Akshay Kumar and Priyanka Chopra took to Twitter to congratulate him. Akshay wrote, "These young boys Sajan and Vedaant have made us...proud. I'm sure it's an amazing feeling as a parent." Priyanka tweeted, "Congratulations Vedaant! That's an amazing feat!"

371.title: Centre notifies merger of 3 municipal corporations in Delhi into 1
371.article_body: The Central government has notified the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2022, merging Delhi's East, South, and North Delhi Municipal Corporations into one. The corporation will be known as the 'Municipal Corporation of Delhi'. The government will also appoint a special officer to discharge functions of the corporation, until the date on which the corporation's first meeting is held.

372.title: 2 students fall off moving bus' footboard in TN; video surfaces
372.article_body: A video of two students falling off a moving bus while they tried to hold onto the vehicle in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi has surfaced online. Locals reportedly rushed the students, who suffered minor injuries after falling off the bus' footboard, to the hospital following the incident. The bus conductor claimed that the students had been trying to perform stunts.

373.title: Parents thrash groom's family after daughter elopes for marriage in Chandigarh
373.article_body: The parents of a woman, who eloped with a man for marriage in Chandigarh, allegedly thrashed the groom's family on Monday. The complainant, Rahul, said the woman's parents and their aides attacked him, his sisters and his parents after his elder brother got married to their daughter against their wish. Rahul suffered fractures in both the legs and arms.

374.title: I knew in my mind I had to take wickets to change game: Chahal on hat-trick
374.article_body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he knew he had to take wickets in the 17th over against KKR to change the momentum of the game. Chasing RR's 218-run target, KKR were 178/4 after 16 overs when Chahal came and picked four wickets, including a hat-trick. "Would've been happy with a dot ball as well on my hat-trick ball," added Chahal.

375.title: Vishal Bhardwaj praises 'desi food' at Priyanka's NYC restaurant, she reacts
375.article_body: Filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj took to Twitter to share a picture from Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York, US. "What a lovely night with friends and the most delicious desi food with a twist in NY. #SonaNewYork," he wrote. Priyanka reacted to Vishal's post and wrote, "So glad you liked it, sir. You're welcome anytime."

376.title: We shot with 100+ dogs, it was really challenging: Arun Vijay on 'Oh My Dog'
376.article_body: While talking about 'Oh My Dog', actor Arun Vijay said it was "really challenging" to work with so many dogs at same time. "I think we shot with nearly 100+ dogs...Having said that...they seemed to have way more fun than...entire cast and crew...Hats off to Raja, the trainer...and our director Sarov to ensure that everything went on smoothly," he added.

377.title: My male friends tell me 'your mom is quite hot': Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak
377.article_body: Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari, in an interview, was asked if her male friends have ever told her that they have a crush on her mother. "They've not said...they've a crush on her, they're like 'Your mom is quite hot'," Palak said, adding, "I was like 'you say this and...my mom is gonna belo (beat with rolling pin) like that'."

378.title: Bengaluru records 51 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 2.91%
378.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 51 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). With 39 new recoveries, the active cases in the city now stand at 1,403. According to official data, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru increased to 2.91% as compared to 1.48% reported on Sunday.

379.title: US drops mask mandate on trains, airplanes after court order
379.article_body: The US government ended the mask mandate for people using public transportation such as trains and airplanes. This comes after a federal judge in Florida declared the 14-month-old directive unlawful. Following the court order, major airlines such as American Airlines, United Airlines and Delta Air Lines lifted the mask mandate. The national train line Amtrak also relaxed the restrictions.

380.title: Delhi's law & order is under Centre: Sharad Pawar on Jahangirpuri violence
380.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday reacted to the violence in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, saying that Delhi's law and order situation comes under the Central government. Pawar added, "We never heard of communal violence during Ram Navami. The reason behind this is the BJP and some of their organisation."

381.title: Haryana to grant same scholarship to general and SC players
381.article_body: Haryana government has decided to grant the same scholarship to general and SC category players. "To boost players across all categories, we have made scholarship in the general category at par with SC category players except for the ₹18,000 for participation to SC players and ₹1,000 extra for female medallists from the state," said Pankaj Nain, Director Sports, Haryana.

382.title: Ranbir holds note saying 'I pledge ₹12 lakh to all bridesmaids' during wedding; pic viral
382.article_body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor holding a note saying 'I, Ranbir, husband of Alia, pledge ₹12 lakh to all the bridesmaids' during his wedding has gone viral. Alia Bhatt's friend Tanya Saha Gupta shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "It's sappy days like these that I live for." Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

383.title: CoinDCX doubles valuation to $2.15 bn, becomes India's most valuable crypto company
383.article_body: CoinDCX has raised $135.9 million in a funding round led by Pantera Capital and Steadview Capital. This led to its valuation being doubled to $2.15 billion in eight months to become the most valued cryptocurrency trading platform in India. CoinDCX plans to use its fund to increase its employees from 400 to 1000 by the end of next year.

384.title: Man in blue kurta seen opening fire during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri arrested
384.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. DCP (Northwest) Usha Rangnani said, "A video was being circulated on social media showing a man in blue kurta opening fire during the riot in Jahangirpuri area."  A sophisticated pistol was recovered from his possession, police said.

385.title: Suspended principal of Mohali institute held for demanding ₹50,000 bribe
385.article_body: The vigilance bureau on Monday arrested a suspended principal of the Industrial Training Institute (Women), Phase 5, Mohali, for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹50,000 from a Ludhiana resident for helping him land an instructor’s job in the institute. The accused man, Shamsher Singh Purkhalvi, was suspended two weeks ago following a slew of complaints against him.

386.title: Girl whose pic with contact details on her back went viral escapes Ukraine war
386.article_body: A girl whose picture with contact details written on her back went viral has escaped Ukraine war along with her mother. The girl's mother Makoviy wrote the details on her back in case they were separated in the war. Makoviy confirmed that she and Vira escaped Ukraine and have been living in a French village with her mother.

387.title: US to no longer conduct anti-satellite tests, first nation to do so
387.article_body: The US has announced that it will no longer conduct anti-satellite (ASAT) missile tests, becoming the first nation to make such a declaration. Vice President Kamala Harris, who chairs the National Space Council, made the announcement. "This commitment addresses one of the most pressing threats to...security...of space, as demonstrated by Russia's...ASAT missile test," the White House said.

388.title: Karnataka govt takes 30% commission on grants reserved for mutts: Seer
388.article_body: A Lingayat seer, Dingaleshwara Swami of Balehosur Mutt, claimed that the Basavaraj Bommai-led Karnataka government takes a 30% commission on grants reserved for the welfare of mutts. "The corruption has reached this level...officials say they cannot be released until commission is paid," the seer added. "For cities like Delhi...funds are like ice creams...we get only ice cream sticks," he stated.

389.title: Ukraine shifting stance, inconsistent during peace talks: Russia
389.article_body: Russia said that Ukraine is "changing its position" on issues previously agreed upon at talks between the two sides and "the trend of the negotiating process leaves much to be desired". "The Ukrainian side isn't consistent in terms of the points that have been agreed," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. However, Peskov said that "contacts continue at an expert level".

390.title: Fearing blackmail over obscene pics, Maha doctor hires people to beat nurse
390.article_body: A doctor and two other accused, who he hired to beat and steal mobile phone of a female nurse, have been arrested by the Ulhasnagar Police. The doctor had doubts about nurse having some obscene pictures of him and thought that she would blackmail him. Police said he gave other accused ₹10,000 to attack the nurse.

391.title: Power crisis in Maharashtra due to mismanagement of MVA govt: BJP leader
391.article_body: BJP leader Girish Mahajan alleged that power crisis in Maharashtra was caused due to "mismanagement" of the MVA government and the previous Devendra Fadnavis-led government ensured the state did not face load-shedding even for a day. "An artificial power shortage is being created, then electricity is bought at higher rates to earn commission, cuts," the BJP leader added.

392.title: Restored hope in justice system: SKM as SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail
392.article_body: Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Monday said that Supreme Court has "restored hope in the justice system" by cancelling Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra's bail in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. SMK added that now Teni should be "sacked from the post of minister", failing which it'll hold a national meeting and announce a nationwide protest programme.

393.title: Hong Kong disposing over 2,000 tonnes of plastic waste daily amid COVID-19
393.article_body: Amid COVID-19, Hong Kong has been disposing over 2,300 tonnes of plastic waste a day, revealed government data. An entrepreneur while speaking from a quarantine hotel in the city said that all staff members wore PPE kits and items like phones, and remotes are cellophane wrapped. Meanwhile, a government spokesperson said officials were aware of the surge in disposable waste.

394.title: Chahal and Buttler's performances were there for the world to see: Samson
394.article_body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after their 7-run win against KKR, RR captain Sanju Samson said, "Yuzvendra Chahal and Jos Buttler's performances were there for the world to see." He added, "Halfway, I thought [our total] was chaseable. KKR played very well...but the wickets helped." Chahal took a hat-trick in his five-wicket haul while Buttler scored 103(61) in the game.

395.title: Umran Malik scares you the same way Jofra Archer does: Ian Bishop
395.article_body: Former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling is as scary as that of England fast bowler Jofra Archer and New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson. "It is just fascinating to me what Umran can become," added Bishop. "He's bowling with hostility which means even the best of batters will be uncomfortable facing him," stated Bishop.

396.title: Dejected parties taking refuge in vote bank, divisive politics: Nadda
396.article_body: Reacting to Opposition parties' joint statement criticising Centre over incidents of communal violence, BJP President JP Nadda said, Opposition is "casting aspersions on our hardworking citizens". Unfortunately, this thrust towards development politics is being bitterly resisted by "rejected and dejected parties" which are "once again taking refuge in vote bank and divisive politics", he added.

397.title: 6 killed, several injured as bus crashes into SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria
397.article_body: Six people died and several others were left injured after a collision between an SUV and a bus in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria on Monday late night. The incident took place when the SUV carrying passengers was returning from a Tilak ceremony. "The bus came from the opposite direction and rammed into the vehicle," Deoria Superintendent of Police Shripati Mishra said.

398.title: Police lathi-charge PHE daily wage workers during protest in J&K
398.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police on Monday lathi-charged some Public Health Engineering (PHE) daily wage workers during their protest for regularisation and release of pending wages in Jammu. The protesters were intercepted by police while they were marching towards Raj Bhawan. "BJP government has betrayed us and if they fail to fulfil our demands...then we'll stop supplying water," a protester said.

399.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels agree to stop using child soldiers: UN
399.article_body: Yemen's Houthi rebels have agreed to stop using child soldiers in armed conflicts, the United Nations has said. A UN official said that the rebels agreed to identify and release children from their ranks within six months. The action plan, which the UN said Houthis signed, also calls for preventing violence against children and attacks on hospitals and schools.

400.title: He only plays 5 or 10 balls every match: Malinga on Riyan Parag's form
400.article_body: Talking about RR batter Riyan Parag, their fast-bowling coach Lasith Malinga said there's no concern over the 20-year-old's form. "He hasn't got much chance...he just plays five or 10 balls every match," stated Malinga. Parag was dismissed for 5 off 3 balls against KKR on Monday and has scored a total of 48 runs in six games so far.
